What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:

Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?

Comments_List: Ancient Greek History from Early Bronze Age to the Rise of Macedon (Alexander the Great)
The class provided me knowledge of key events in Ancient Greece as well as skills to critically analyze both secondary and primary sources.
It was great! Loved the class

I developed a basic understanding of the arc of Ancient Greek history from the Bronze Age to the Hellenistic. I learned about the personalities, events, and factors influencing the growth of this fascinating and multifaceted culture. I also learned how to think critically about history and about methods of historical study.
A great introduction to Ancient Greek history. Very happy with the knowledge I acquired throughout the course.
A great survey of Greek history, which permeates our culture in so many ways, and a cool opportunity to read some of the greatest texts of antiquity!
I learnt to how to analyze both primary and secondary sources in history.
Felt like I received a fantastic overview of Greek history from the time of Homer to Alexander.
I learned how to learn in both a lecture setting and the specific topics we looked into for weekly sections.
The slides are super informative and the class is very organized! The reading materials are also pretty engaging.
Great teacher and TA

The course covers fascinating material which is both interesting in its own right and essential to understanding our own modern world. The course is well-organized and moves through a great deal of material. I learned so much.
Interesting content taught well by a fantastic professor
Overall the course is very well structured for learning, lectures are always clearly linked to a greater narrative. I can't think of any significant improvements that could be made.

Strength: it gives a general overview about the history in Ancient Greece, which helps students to understand the very basis of western civilization
Weakness: this course doesnt dip deeply into any specific period/ person/ place
Great professor and accompanying TA's. Loved how each class covered a certain theme or topic related to Greek history.
It was an interesting and comprehensive course that provided in depth but not overly complex information about Ancient Greece.
Yes. Ancient Greek History is really interesting!
Yes as everyone can benefit from the knowledge and skills gained in this class.
Absolutely!

I absolutely would. Learning Greek history is both a pleasure  think of the statecraft of Themistocles and Pericles, or the mystery of the Minoans  and a thing necessary for anyone who wants to understand the development and continuing evolution of the modern world.
I would recommend it. Francois is a great professor and a very nice person. The content is very interesting.
Yes! It is really cool to learn about ancient Greece, and this class will likely make you want to dive further into some texts that you didn't have time to cover throughout the semester.
Yes! If they hope to understand the foundation of ancient history/ classics
Certainly. Greek history provides interested students with valuable insight into the formation of modern society.

Yes; for anyone interested in archaeology, classics/classical civilizations, and history in general, this is a wonderful course to take, especially to find other areas of interest within the covered time period.
